hymn.title: Lord, make me to know mine end

layout.singingstanza: Lord, make me to know mine end, And the mea -- sure of my days, what it is, That I may know how frail I am, How frail I am. Be -- hold, Thou hast made my days as an hand -- breadth; And mine age is as noth -- ing be -- fore Thee; Ver -- i -- ly ev -- ery man at his best state, Is al -- to -- geth -- er van -- i -- ty. Se -- lah. Sure -- ly ev -- ery man walk -- eth in a vain show; Sure -- ly they are dis -- quiet -- ed in vain; He heap -- eth up rich -- es, and know -- eth not Who shall gath -- er them. And now, Lord, what wait I for? My hope is in Thee. Now Lord, what wait I for? My hope is in Thee. My hope is in Thee.

lyrics.stanza: Lord, make me to know mine end, And the measure of my days, what it is, That I may know how frail I am, How frail I am.
And now, Lord, what wait I for? My hope is in Thee. Now Lord, what wait I for? My hope is in Thee. My hope is in Thee. (repeat stanzas 3 and 4)
